clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Teriparatide or Zoledronic Acid Treatment on Bone in Postmenopausal Osteoporotic Women
clinical_study.official_title: Skeletal Histomorphometry in Patients on Teriparatide or Zoledronic Acid Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate how teriparatide or zoledronic acid affects the bone of postmenopausal osteoporotic women after 6 months of treatment as determined by a bone biopsy sample taken from the iliac crest (upper part of the pelvis). After completing 12 months of treatment all participants are eligible to participate in an additional 12-month open label extension.

primary_outcome.measure: Mineralizing Surface/Bone Surface (MS/BS) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
primary_outcome.description: MS/BS in CC is a measure of the proportion of BS on which new mineralized bone is deposited at the time of tetracycline (T) labeling and is calculated as sum of total extent of double label (DL) plus half the extent of single label (SL) divided by BS. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in the biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under a microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or no label (NL) suggests suppression of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mineralizing Surface/Bone Surface (MS/BS) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: MS/BS in CC is a measure of the proportion of BS on which new mineralized bone is deposited at the time of tetracycline (T) labeling and is calculated as sum of total extent of double label (DL) plus half the extent of single label (SL) divided by BS. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in the biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under a microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or no label (NL) suggests suppression of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mineralizing Surface/Bone Surface(MS/BS) in the Endocortical Compartment (EC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 and 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: MS/BS in EC is a measure of the proportion of BS on which new mineralized bone is deposited at the time of tetracycline (T) labeling and is calculated as sum of total extent of double label (DL) plus half the extent of single label (SL) divided by BS. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in the biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under a microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or no label (NL) suggests suppression of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Activation Frequency (Ac.f) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Ac.f in CC represents the frequency of activation of new remodeling cycles on BS (bone formation rate [BFR]/BS divided by wall thickness) and is expressed in units of new cycles per unit of time. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 micrometer (µm)/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Activation Frequency (Ac.f) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Ac.f in CC represents the frequency of activation of new remodeling cycles on the bone surface (BFR/BS divided by wall thickness) and is expressed in units of new cycles per unit of time. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Activation Frequency (Ac.f) in the Endocortical Compartment (EC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 and 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Ac.f in EC represents the frequency of activation of new remodeling cycles on the bone surface (BFR/BS divided by wall thickness) and is expressed in units of new cycles per unit of time. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone Formation Rate (BFR) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: BFR in CC is the volume of mineralized bone formed per unit surface bone per unit time (cubic millimeter/square millimeter/year [mm³/mm²/year]); calculated as mineral apposition rate (MAR) times MS/BS. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone Formation Rate (BFR) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: BFR in CC is the volume of mineralized bone formed per unit surface bone per unit time (mm³/mm²/year); calculated as MAR times MS/BS. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone Formation Rate (BFR) in the Endocortical Compartment (EC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 and 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: BFR in EC is the volume of mineralized bone formed per unit surface bone per unit time (mm³/mm²/year); calculated as MAR times MS/BS. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mineral Apposition Rate (MAR) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: MAR in CC is a measure of the linear rate of production of mineralized bone matrix by osteoblasts and is measured by the mean distance between two consecutive T labels divided by the time interval. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mineral Apposition Rate (MAR) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: MAR in CC is a measure of the linear rate of production of mineralized bone matrix by osteoblasts and is measured by the mean distance between two consecutive labels divided by the time interval. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mineral Apposition Rate (MAR) in the Endocortical Compartment (EC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 and 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: MAR in EC is a measure of the linear rate of production of mineralized bone matrix by osteoblasts and is measured by the mean distance between two consecutive labels divided by the time interval. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Apposition Rate (Aj.AR) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Aj.AR in CC is MAR averaged over the entire osteoid surface and in a steady state is an estimate of the mean rate of matrix apposition. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Apposition Rate (Aj.AR) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Aj.AR in CC is MAR averaged over the entire osteoid surface and in a steady state is an estimate of the mean rate of matrix apposition. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Apposition Rate (Aj.AR) in the Endocortical Compartment (EC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 and 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Aj.AR in EC is MAR averaged over the entire osteoid surface and in a steady state is an estimate of the mean rate of matrix apposition. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mineralization Lag Time (Mlt) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Mlt in CC is the period between deposition and subsequent mineralization of osteoid. Mlt is calculated as Osteoid Thickness (O.Th) divided by Aj.AR. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mineralization Lag Time (Mlt) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Mlt in CC is the period between deposition and subsequent mineralization of osteoid. Mlt is calculated as O.Th divided by Aj.AR. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mineralization Lag Time (Mlt) in the Endocortical Compartment (EC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 and 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Mlt in EC is the period between deposition and subsequent mineralization of osteoid. Mlt is calculated as O.Th divided by Aj.AR. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Osteoid Maturation Time (Omt) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Omt in CC is the period between the onset of deposition and onset of mineralization of a given amount of osteoid. Omt is calculated as O.Th divided by MAR. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Osteoid Maturation Time (Omt) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Omt in CC is the period between the onset of deposition and onset of mineralization of a given amount of osteoid. Omt is calculated as O.Th divided by MAR. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.description: Omt in EC is the period between the onset of deposition and onset of mineralization of a given amount of osteoid. Omt is calculated as O.Th divided by MAR. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. secondary_outcome.measure: Total Formation Period (Tt.FP) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Tt.FP in CC is a measure of bone formation and is calculated as wall thickness divided by Aj.AR. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.description: Tt.FP in EC is a measure of bone formation and is calculated as wall thickness divided by Aj.AR. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Active Formation Period (a.FP) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: a. FP in CC is the mean time required to rebuild a new bone structural unit, calculated as wall thickness divided by MAR. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.

secondary_outcome.description: a. FP in CC is the mean time required to rebuild a new bone structural unit, calculated as wall thickness divided by MAR. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. secondary_outcome.description: a. FP in EC is the mean time required to rebuild a new bone structural unit, calculated as wall thickness divided by MAR. Participants were given T for two 3 day-periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. secondary_outcome.description: The percent of single or double tetracycline labels per bone surface (sLS/BS, dLS/BS) in the cancellous compartment. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation.

Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of samples with single or double tetracycline labels, both single and double labels, or no labels in the cancellous compartment were compared between teriparatide and zoledronic acid treated participants. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. secondary_outcome.description: The length of tetracycline double labels is a measure of the extent of bone formation in the cancellous compartment within individual remodeling units and is measured in millimeters (mm). Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Length of Tetracycline Double Labels in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The length of tetracycline double labels is a measure of the extent of bone formation in the cancellous compartment within individual remodeling units and is measured in millimeters (mm). Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Length of Tetracycline Double Labels in the Endocortical Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 and 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The length of tetracycline double labels is a measure of the extent of bone formation in the endocortical compartment within individual remodeling units and is measured in millimeters (mm). Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Osteoid Volume (OV)/Bone Volume (BV) in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Osteoid volume (OV) in the cancellous compartment is the percent of a given volume of bone tissue that consists of unmineralized bone (osteoid).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Osteoid Volume (OV)/Bone Volume (BV) in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Osteoid volume (OV) in the cancellous compartment is the percent of a given volume of bone tissue that consists of unmineralized bone (osteoid).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Osteoid Surface (OS)/Bone Surface (BS) in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Osteoid surface (OS) in the cancellous compartment is the fraction (%) of the entire trabecular bone surface that is covered by osteoid.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Osteoid Surface (OS)/Bone Surface (BS) in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Osteoid surface (OS) in the cancellous compartment is the fraction (%) of the entire trabecular bone surface that is covered by osteoid.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Osteoid Surface (OS)/Bone Surface (BS) in the Endocortical Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 and 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Osteoid surface (OS) in the endocortical compartment is the fraction (%) of the entire trabecular bone surface that is covered by osteoid.

secondary_outcome.measure: Osteoid Thickness (OTh.) in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Osteoid thickness (OTh.) in the cancellous compartment is a measure of the average thickness of osteoid seams.

secondary_outcome.measure: Osteoid Thickness (OTh.) in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Osteoid thickness (OTh.) in the cancellous compartment is a measure of the average thickness of osteoid seams.

secondary_outcome.measure: Osteoid Thickness (OTh.) in the Endocortical Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 and 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Osteoid thickness (OTh.) in the endocortical compartment is a measure of the average thickness of osteoid seams.

secondary_outcome.measure: Wall Thickness (WTh.) in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Wall thickness (WTh.) in the cancellous compartment is measured as the mean distance from the cement line to the marrow space of completed trabecular bone packets.

secondary_outcome.measure: Wall Thickness (WTh.) in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Wall thickness (WTh.) in the cancellous compartment is measured as the mean distance from the cement line to the marrow space of completed trabecular bone packets.

secondary_outcome.measure: Wall Thickness (WTh.) in the Endocortical Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 and 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Wall thickness (WTh.) in the endocortical compartment is measured as the mean distance from the cement line to the marrow space of completed trabecular bone packets.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eroded Surface/Bone Surface (ES/BS) in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Eroded surface/bone surface (ES/BS) in the cancellous compartment is the fraction of the entire trabecular surface occupied by resorption bays, including both those with and without osteoclasts. It is an indicator of bone resorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eroded Surface/Bone Surface (ES/BS) in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Eroded surface/bone surface (ES/BS) in the cancellous compartment is the fraction of the entire trabecular surface occupied by resorption bays, including both those with and without osteoclasts. It is an indicator of bone resorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eroded Surface/Bone Surface (ES/BS) in the Endocortical Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 and 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Eroded surface/bone surface (ES/BS) in the endocortical compartment is the fraction of the entire trabecular surface occupied by resorption bays, including both those with and without osteoclasts. It is an indicator of bone resorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Serum Carboxyterminal Cross-Linking Telopeptide of Type I Collagen (CTX) at Month 1, 3 and 6 Endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: CTX is a measure of bone resorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Serum Carboxyterminal Cross-Linking Telopeptide of Type I Collagen (CTX) at Month 12 Endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: CTX is a measure of bone resorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Serum Procollagen Type I N-Terminal Propeptide (PINP) at Month 1, 3 and 6 Endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: PINP is a measure of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Serum Procollagen Type I N-Terminal Propeptide (PINP) at Month 12 Endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: PINP is a measure of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Serum Osteocalcin (OC) at Month 1, 3, and 6 Endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: OC is a measure of osteoblast function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Serum Osteocalcin (OC) at Month 12 Endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: OC is a measure of osteoblast function.

intervention.description: 20 microgram (mcg) subcutaneous (SC) injection per day for 12 months. Placebo intravenous (IV) infusions were given to maintain blind. After completing 12 months of treatment, all participants are eligible to participate in an additional 12-month extension.

5 milligram (mg) intravenous (IV) infusion administered once during 1 year study. Placebo subcutaneous (SC) injections were given to maintain blind. After completing 12 months of treatment, all participants are eligible to participate in an additional 12-month extension.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ambulatory, postmenopausal women with osteoporosis (no vaginal bleeding for at least 2 years prior to trial entry)
- Free of severe or chronically disabling conditions other than osteoporosis that will impair ability to complete the trial
- Bone mineral density (BMD) T-score of at least -2.5 at the femoral neck, total hip, or lumbar spine (L1-L4, with at least 2 evaluable vertebrae), with or without atraumatic fracture or,
- Bone mineral density (BMD) T-score of at least -1.5 at the femoral neck, or total hip, or lumbar spine (L1-L4, with at least 2 evaluable vertebrae), and either 1 or more atraumatic vertebral fracture(s) or an atraumatic nonvertebral fracture in the opinion of the investigator. Nonvertebral fracture sites allowed are wrist, hip, pelvis, ribs, humerus, clavicle, leg (femur, tibia, and fibula, excluding the ankle).
- Serum calcium, parathyroid hormone (PTH), alkaline phosphatase must be within normal reference range
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have an increased risk of osteosarcoma (bone tumor); this includes Paget's disease of bone, a previous bone tumor, or radiation involving the skeleton
- Are allergic or cannot tolerate teriparatide or zoledronic acid or any of their ingredients or components
- Are allergic to tetracycline
- Have a history of exposure to tetracycline therapy in the 3 months prior to trial entry
- Have participated in a prior PTH clinical trial or received prior treatment with teriparatide, PTH, or other related medications
- Have a vitamin D level below 10 nanogram/milliliter (ng/mL)
- Have a condition that could possibly put one at risk for an adverse event due to the bone biopsy procedure (e.g. bleeding disorder)
- Have undergone two previous iliac crest bone biopsies (one in each iliac crest)
- Have taken any intravenous (IV) osteoporosis medication
- Have taken other oral osteoporosis medications and have not been off of them for a specific period of time before trial entry
- Have a history of certain cancers in the 5 years prior to trial entry
- Have active liver disease
- Have significantly impaired kidney function
- Currently have active or suspected diseases that affect the bones, other than osteoporosis
- Have active or recent history of significant gastrointestinal (stomach or intestinal) disorders
- Have been treated with certain glucocorticoids for more than 30 days in the past 1 year prior to trial entry

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This was a Phase 4, multicenter, randomized, stratified, double-blind, active comparator-controlled study with the primary endpoint at 6 months. Following the bone biopsy visit at 6 months, the study became open label for an additional 6 months. All participants who complete 12 months of treatment are eligible for an additional 12-month extension.

group.title: Teriparatide
group.description: 20 microgram (mcg) subcutaneous (SC) injection per day for 12 months. Placebo intravenous (IV) infusions were given to maintain blind. After completing 12 months of treatment, all participants are eligible to participate in an additional 12-month extension.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid
group.description: 5 milligram (mg) intravenous (IV) infusion administered once during 1 year study. Placebo subcutaneous (SC) injections were given to maintain blind. After completing 12 months of treatment, all participants are eligible to participate in an additional 12-month extension.

participants_list.participants: Not all participants who completed 12 months of primary study chose to enter 12-month extension.

measure.description: Yes means a participant has already had fracture before study entry.

measure.title: Lumbar Spine T-Score
measure.description: The T-score at lumbar spine is a comparison of a participant's bone mineral density (BMD) to that of the mean BMD for a healthy population of women at peak bone mass (30 years). A normal T-score has a value of -1.0 or higher. Osteoporosis is defined as a T-score of -2.5 or lower, meaning a bone mineral density that is two and a half standard deviations below the mean BMD of a healthy population of women at peak bone mass (30 years).

measure.title: Femoral Neck T-Score
measure.description: The T-score at femoral neck is a comparison of a participant's bone mineral density (BMD) to that of the mean BMD for a healthy population of women at peak bone mass (30 years). A normal T-score has a value of -1.0 or higher. Osteoporosis is defined as a T-score of -2.5 or lower, meaning a bone mineral density that is two and a half standard deviations below the mean BMD of a healthy population of women at peak bone mass (30 years).

measure.title: Total Hip T-Score
measure.description: The T-score at total hip is a comparison of a participant's bone mineral density (BMD) to that of the mean BMD for a healthy population of women at peak bone mass (30 years). A normal T-score has a value of -1.0 or higher. Osteoporosis is defined as a T-score of -2.5 or lower, meaning a bone mineral density that is two and a half standard deviations below the mean BMD of a healthy population of women at peak bone mass (30 years).

measure.title: Serum Procollagen Type I N-Terminal Propeptide (PINP)
measure.description: A measure of bone formation.

measure.title: Serum Carboxyterminal Cross-Linking Telopeptide of Collagen Type I (CTX)
measure.description: A measure of bone resorption.

measure.title: Serum Osteocalcin
measure.description: A measure of osteoblast function.

outcome.title: Mineralizing Surface/Bone Surface (MS/BS) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
outcome.description: MS/BS in CC is a measure of the proportion of BS on which new mineralized bone is deposited at the time of tetracycline (T) labeling and is calculated as sum of total extent of double label (DL) plus half the extent of single label (SL) divided by BS. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in the biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under a microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or no label (NL) suggests suppression of bone formation.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug with an evaluable bone biopsy.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is for 6 months.
P-value is for 24 months.

outcome.title: Activation Frequency (Ac.f) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
outcome.description: Ac.f in CC represents the frequency of activation of new remodeling cycles on BS (bone formation rate [BFR]/BS divided by wall thickness) and is expressed in units of new cycles per unit of time. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 micrometer (µm)/day or counted as missing.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug with an evaluable bone biopsy.

outcome.title: Bone Formation Rate (BFR) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
outcome.description: BFR in CC is the volume of mineralized bone formed per unit surface bone per unit time (cubic millimeter/square millimeter/year [mm³/mm²/year]); calculated as mineral apposition rate (MAR) times MS/BS. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug with an evaluable bone biopsy.

outcome.title: Mineral Apposition Rate (MAR) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
outcome.description: MAR in CC is a measure of the linear rate of production of mineralized bone matrix by osteoblasts and is measured by the mean distance between two consecutive T labels divided by the time interval. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug with an evaluable bone biopsy.

group.title: Teriparatide
group.description: 20 microgram (mcg) subcutaneous (SC) injection per day for 12 months. Placebo intravenous (IV) infusions were given to maintain blind. After completing 12 months of treatment, all participants are eligible to participate in an additional 12-month extension.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid
group.description: 5 milligram (mg) intravenous (IV) infusion administered once during 1 year study. Placebo subcutaneous (SC) injections were given to maintain blind. After completing 12 months of treatment, all participants are eligible to participate in an additional 12-month extension.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is for double labels (DL) and no labels (NL).
P-value is for double labels (DL), imputed single labels (ISL) and no labels (NL).

outcome.title: Adjusted Apposition Rate (Aj.AR) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
outcome.description: Aj.AR in CC is MAR averaged over the entire osteoid surface and in a steady state is an estimate of the mean rate of matrix apposition. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug with an evaluable bone biopsy.

outcome.title: Mineralization Lag Time (Mlt) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
outcome.description: Mlt in CC is the period between deposition and subsequent mineralization of osteoid. Mlt is calculated as Osteoid Thickness (O.Th) divided by Aj.AR. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug with an evaluable bone biopsy.

outcome.title: Osteoid Maturation Time (Omt) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
outcome.description: Omt in CC is the period between the onset of deposition and onset of mineralization of a given amount of osteoid. Omt is calculated as O.Th divided by MAR. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug with an evaluable bone biopsy.

outcome.title: Total Formation Period (Tt.FP) in the Cancellous Compartment (CC) of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 24 Months
outcome.description: Tt.FP in CC is a measure of bone formation and is calculated as wall thickness divided by Aj.AR. Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation. SL cases were imputed to a value of 0.3 µm/day or counted as missing.
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug with an evaluable bone biopsy and had Tt.FP analysis of the CC at 24 months.

outcome.title: Average Length of Tetracycline Double Labels in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
outcome.description: The length of tetracycline double labels is a measure of the extent of bone formation in the cancellous compartment within individual remodeling units and is measured in millimeters (mm). Participants were given T for two 3-day periods, 14 days apart. T fluoresces under certain light and temporarily binds to new bone. New bone in biopsy is seen as the amount of bone between 2 fluorescently T labeled lines under microscope. DL indicates active bone formation, SL or NL suggests suppression of bone formation.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug with an evaluable bone biopsy.

measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug with an evaluable bone biopsy and had length of tetracycline double labels analysis of the endocortical compartment at 6 and 24 months.

outcome.title: Percentage of Eroded Surface/Bone Surface (ES/BS) in the Cancellous Compartment of Iliac Crest Bone Biopsies at 6 Months
outcome.description: Eroded surface/bone surface (ES/BS) in the cancellous compartment is the fraction of the entire trabecular surface occupied by resorption bays, including both those with and without osteoclasts. It is an indicator of bone resorption.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug with an evaluable bone biopsy.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
